biography.bio: Simon Yam was born 19 March, 1955, also known as Yam Tat-wah, is a veteran Hong Kong-based actor and film producer. He started off as a supermodel before becoming an actor in the mid 1970s. He then signed with the Hong Kong television network TVB, starring and co-starring in a number of television series prior to "apply his trades" in the film industry in 1987. His elder brother is Yam Tak-wing, a retired former Deputy Commissioner of Hong Kong Police. In 1989, he starred in the Japanese-Hong Kong co-production of Bloodfight (1989). This was the first of its kind in which English was spoken throughout the entire film. In 1992, Yam gained critical acclaim for his role as the maniacal Judge in the crime film Full Contact (1992), where he faced off in a bloody battle against Yun-Fat Chow's character. In 1993, he starred as "Dhalsim" in the action-comedy film Future Cops (1993), a parody of Street Fighter directed by Jing Wong. In 1996, Yam began his role as Chiang Tin-Sung, the leader of the Hung Hing triads in the first three installments of the Young and Dangerous (1996) film series. In 2000, Yam starred as Cheung-sun, the progenitor of all vampires, in the television series Ngo wo geun see yau gor yue wui II (2000), produced by ATV. In 2003, Yam made his Hollywood film debut in Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life (2003) as Shaolin crime lord. Yam received international acclaim for his performances in international film festival hits and box offices such as Naked Killer (1992), S.P.L. (2005), Election (2005), Triad Election (2006), Exilé (2006), Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life (2003), The Thieves (2012).
biography.name: Simon Yam

biography.bio: Irene Wan was born on July 30, 1966 in Hong Kong, China. She is an actress and producer, known for Rouge (1987), Exodus (2007) and Lonely Fifteen (1982).
biography.name: Irene Wan

biography.bio: Alfred Cheung was born on January 1, 1955. He is an actor and writer, known for Le médaillon (2003), Biao jie, ni hao ye! (1990) and Biao jie, ni hao ye! xu ji (1991).
biography.name: Alfred Cheung

biography.bio: Chi Wah Wong was born on September 5, 1960 in Hong Kong. He is an actor and writer, known for Thunderbolt (1995), Yan gaan sik seung (1996) and Yi wen ji bao biao (2002).
biography.name: Chi Wah Wong

biography.bio: Joe Chu was born as Joseph Chi Chong Chavez. He is known for his work on La secte du lotus blanc (1992), All About Ah-Long (1989) and Prison on Fire (1987).
biography.name: Joe Chu

biography.bio: Kai-Cheung Chung is a writer and director, known for A-1 Headline (2004), Wong Kok cha 'fit' yan (1996) and Hui ba! Ja 'fit' yan bing tuen (1996).
biography.name: Kai-Cheung Chung

biography.bio: Yue Fong is an actress, known for Mr. Boo contre Pom Pom (1985), Ting yin jian (1969) and Miracles - Mr. Canton and Lady Rose (1989).
biography.name: Yue Fong

biography.bio: Chiu-Wing Lam is an actor and writer, known for Vulgaria (2012), Shaolin Basket (2008) and Dancing Lion (2007).
biography.name: Chiu-Wing Lam

biography.bio: Chi-Kei Lee is an actor, known for New Police Story (2004), L'hôtesse de la violence (1988) and Beyond the Realm of Conscience (2009).
biography.name: Chi-Kei Lee

biography.bio: Chi Ming Leung is an actor and cinematographer, known for Pedicab Driver (1989), Esprit d'amour (1983) and Lethal Lady (1990).
biography.name: Chi Ming Leung

biography.bio: Hung Lu is known for his work on Out of the Dark (1995), Chinese Box (1997) and The Legend (1993).
biography.name: Hung Lu

biography.bio: On-Yuk Mak is an actress, known for All of a Sudden (1996) and Huan le shi guang (1995).
biography.name: On-Yuk Mak

biography.bio: Peter Ngor is a cinematographer and actor, known for Mister Dynamite (1986), Mr. Vampire (1985) and Chinese Odyssey 2002 (2002).
biography.name: Peter Ngor

biography.bio: Steven Poon is an actor, known for All of a Sudden (1996) and Snake Devil (1995).
biography.name: Steven Poon

biography.bio: Wing-San Tang is an actor, known for My Father is a Hero (1995), When Fortune Smiles (1990) and City of Glass (1998).
biography.name: Wing-San Tang
